alert.note: Alert for Boulder (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 10:55PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Boulder. * WHEN...Until 200 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dry Creek, Boulder Creek and Left Hand Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boulder and Niwot.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
